title: Implement GET /api/sites API
body:
## Description
Implement the GET /api/sites API endpoint according to the specification in `specs/api/sites/GET_sites.md`.

## Requirements
- Return an array of published site configurations
- Support pagination for large result sets
- Allow filtering by optional query parameters
- Include essential site details in the response
- Return only published sites that are meant for public viewing
- Exclude any sensitive or internal site configuration details
- Implement aggressive caching for improved performance

## Acceptance Criteria
- API endpoint follows the specification exactly
- Only published sites are returned
- Pagination works correctly
- Sorting options work as expected
- Response time is < 200ms for typical requests
- Proper error handling is implemented
- Rate limiting is implemented to prevent abuse
- Appropriate cache headers are included for CDN compatibility
- Unit tests cover all scenarios in the specification
- Integration tests verify the API works end-to-end

## Related Specifications
- `specs/api/sites/GET_sites.md`

title: Implement GET /api/sites/[siteSlug] API
body:
## Description
Implement the GET /api/sites/[siteSlug] API endpoint according to the specification in `specs/api/sites/GET_site_by_slug.md`.

## Requirements
- Retrieve site details by slug
- Handle test environment by using appropriate key prefixes
- Return complete site configuration data
- Convert any string JSON responses to proper objects
- Implement tenant context validation for administrative access
- Support public access for site frontend rendering with limited data
- Handle permissions appropriately based on access context

## Acceptance Criteria
- API endpoint follows the specification exactly
- Site data is returned correctly
- JSON strings from Redis are properly parsed
- Tenant isolation is enforced for admin access
- Public access is properly supported with limited data
- Proper error handling is implemented
- Unit tests cover all scenarios in the specification
- Integration tests verify the API works end-to-end
